factText: Local Assistance Centers are opening for those affected by the recent Southern California Wildfires. MESSAGE FOR WILD FIRE VICTIMS OF CALIFORNIA *** If you live in Ventura, Santa Barbara, Riverside, San Bernardino, Los Angeles & San Diego Counties, and have been affected by the fires, there is a Need. UPDATE: Red flag warnings remain in effect for Los Angeles and Ventura counties through Wednesday evening, with elevated fire weather conditions and gusty winds.
Thousands of people have been evacuated as fires burn across North County. People from 107 households impacted by the Lilac Fire signed up for services at the County’s Local Assistance Center Monday.

The racing community is rallying to help after Thursday’s Lilac Fire devastated the San Luis Rey Downs Training Center, and you can join the efforts to address the needs of displaced horses and backst

factText: #LilacFire UPDATE: The Lilac Fire is now 90% contained and all evacuation orders have been lifted.… https://t.co/ppqEFLN5dI. Friends and neighbors, evacuation orders were lifted this afternoon and San Diego Audubon staff returned to find the structures and 11 acre preserve intact. With all evacuation orders lifted in the #LilacFire -- many residents returned today to the Rancho Monserate community decimated by flames.

factText: About 56 customers affected by the Lilac Fire were still without power Monday night after SDG&E made precautionary shutdowns in several wind-prone areas. A decision to cut power – on purpose – to thousands of residents in Riverside County mountain communities for about 33 hours to prevent arcing power lines from sparking wildfires during high winds. The around 33 hour power outage in the Riverside County mountain communities last week affected 3,100 Edison customers, company officials said.
Flipping thru channels and right now on Spectrum Channel 85 (CNC) is the County Board of Supervisors declaring a state of emergency today as it relates to the fires.

The Lilac Fire destroyed more than 180 structures, roughly half of which were homes, considered in the wildland urban interface.
